events.canonical_org_name: Bank of Russia (Central Bank of Russia)
roles: Governor of the Bank of Russia
Governor of the Central Bank of Russia
head of the Central Bank of Russia
Governor of the Central Bank of Russia
supporting_quotes: Elvira Nabiullina - Wikipedia Russian economist and Governor of the Bank of Russia
current governor of the Central Bank of Russia
Succeeding Sergey Ignatyev in 2013, Nabiullina was appointed head of the Central Bank of Russia,
Euromoney magazine named her their 2015 Central Bank Governor of the Year.
In 2017, the British magazine The Banker chose Nabiullina as 'Central Banker of the Year, Europe'.
There is a belief in the Russian media that the head of the Central Bank uses brooches at public events to signal the state of the economy and the regulator's plans.
Central bank governor Nabiullina displays crisis fighting skills.
Central Banker of the Year 2017.
Russia's central bank head 'is mourning for her economy'.
US Sanctions Russian Central Bank Chief Nabiullina.
Governor of the Central Bank of Russia 2013–present
events.notes: Multiple roles merged as they refer to the same position at the Central Bank of Russia with overlapping time periods.

roles: Aide to the President of Russia
Assistant to President Putin for Economic Affairs
supporting_quotes: Aide to the President of Russia In office 22 May 2012 – 24 June 2013
She was President Vladimir Putin's economic adviser from May 2012 to June 2013
From May 2012 to June 2013, she served as Assistant to President Putin for Economic Affairs.
events.notes: Roles merged as they refer to the same advisory position in the Kremlin administration with overlapping time periods.

events.canonical_org_name: Ministry for Economic Development and Trade
supporting_quotes: Minister of Economic Development In office 24 September 2007 – 21 May 2012
after serving as the minister of economic development from September 2007 to May 2012
Between 2003 and her September 2007 appointment as minister, she chaired the Center for Strategic Development as well as an advisory committee preparing for Russia's 2006 presidency of the G8.
events.notes: Roles merged as they refer to the same ministerial position with overlapping time periods.

events.canonical_org_name: Ministry for Economic Development and Trade
supporting_quotes: In 1994, she moved to the Ministry for Economic Development and Trade, where she rose to the level of deputy minister by 1997;
before returning to the Ministry for Economic Development and Trade as first deputy in 2000.
events.notes: Roles kept separate as they are distinct positions within the same organization.

supporting_quotes: She spent the next two years with Sberbank as its chief executive and with former Economic Development and Trade Minister German Gref's non-governmental think tank, the Center for Strategic Development,

events.canonical_org_name: USSR Science and Industry Union / Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs
supporting_quotes: Between 1991 and 1994, Nabiullina worked at the USSR Science and Industry Union and its successor, the Russian Union of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs.
events.notes: Role not specified, but event created based on organizational affiliation.

supporting_quotes: In May 2014 she was named one of the world's most powerful women by Forbes,
Euromoney magazine named her their 2015 Central Bank Governor of the Year.
In 2017, the British magazine The Banker chose Nabiullina as 'Central Banker of the Year, Europe'.
selected for the 2007 Yale World Fellows program.
events.notes: Role not specified, but event created based on organizational affiliation.

deduplication_log.reasoning: All roles refer to the same position at the Central Bank of Russia with overlapping time periods.
Roles refer to the same advisory position in the Kremlin administration with overlapping time periods.
Roles refer to the same ministerial position with overlapping time periods.
Distinct positions within the same organization with different time periods.
